wikipedia_page.main: Erik Blegvad (Danish pronunciation: [ˈb̥lɑjˌvæːð]; 3 March 1923 – 14 January 2014) was a British illustrator of the various books, including The Winter Bear and The Borrowers. He died on 14 January 2014 at the age of 90, which was confirmed by his son Peter because it wasn't widely reported.

Peter Blegvad (born August 14, 1951) is an American musician, singer-songwriter, writer, and cartoonist. He was a founding member of German/English avant-pop band Slapp Happy, which later merged briefly with Henry Cow, and has released many solo and collaborative albums. He is the son of Lenore and Erik Blegvad, who were respectively, a children's book author and illustrator.

The Amazing Vacation is a children's fantasy novel written in 1956 by Dan Wickenden, illustrated by Erik Blegvad. It is very rare, with fewer than 50 copies available in libraries. It is fondly remembered by children of the era, and has been cited by authors as one of the formative books of their childhood.
